content:
ValidationDataType Enum

Definition

Specifies the validation data types used by the CompareValidator and RangeValidator controls.

In this Article

public enum ValidationDataType
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
System.Enum
ValidationDataType

Remarks

The ValidationDataType enumeration represents the different data types that the CompareValidator and RangeValidator controls can validate. When you specify a data type for validation control and the input control being validated passes validation, the value of the input control can be parsed to the specified data type.

Fields

Currency

A monetary data type. The value is treated as a Decimal. However, currency and grouping symbols are still allowed.
Date

A date data type. Only numeric dates are allowed. The time portion cannot be specified.
Double

A double precision floating point number data type. The value is treated as a Double.
Integer

A 32-bit signed integer data type. The value is treated as a Int32.
String

A string data type. The value is treated as a String.
